H0.text: Which art movement, founded in a Zurich caf during World War I and consolidated at a meeting held in Paris in 1920, was led by Tristan Tzara. Surrealism

H1.text: Which art movement, founded in a Zurich caf during World War I and consolidated at a meeting held in Paris in 1920, was led by Tristan Tzara. Cubism

H2.text: Which art movement, founded in a Zurich caf during World War I and consolidated at a meeting held in Paris in 1920, was led by Tristan Tzara. Futurism

H3.text: Which art movement, founded in a Zurich caf during World War I and consolidated at a meeting held in Paris in 1920, was led by Tristan Tzara. Dada

A4.text: Zürich Dada, with Tzara at the helm, published the art and literature review Dada beginning in July 1917.

A5.text: After the war, the artists published a series of short-lived political magazines and held the First International Dada Fair, 'the greatest project yet conceived by the Berlin Dadaists', in the summer of 1920.

A6.text: he was known best for being one of the founders and central figures of the anti‑establishment Dada movement.

A7.text: As early as 1916, Tristan Tzara took distance from the Italian Futurists, rejecting the militarist and proto‑fascist stance of their leader Filippo Tommaso Marinetti.
